resources.string:
"Hello, I'm Anyelys. 

 I am interested in Android development and I am practicing layouts, styles, and accessibility. In my free time I learn Kotlin, build small projects, and enjoy documenting what I learn. This text is long enough to allow scrolling.


Skills: Kotlin, Android Studio, Git, XML layouts, Firebase, REST APIs, MVVM Architecture.
 Goal: improve best practices and publish my first app on the Play Store.


Personal experience: I have been exploring how ViewGroups such as LinearLayout, ConstraintLayout, and ScrollView work, and how they combine to create dynamic and user-friendly interfaces. I am also learning about Material Design to enhance the usability of my applications.


Hobbies: I enjoy reading about new technologies, practicing programming logic, and solving online challenges. I also like collaborating with other students and sharing code on GitHub repositories.


Future: I plan to expand my knowledge into Jetpack Compose, local databases with Room, and cloud service integration. My medium-term goal is to work on a project that positively impacts users.


Note: this text is long enough so that you can scroll within the ScrollView and see how navigation works in Android. It is a good practice example to distinguish between simple views and view containers."
